channel.title: AxoControl Case File
channel.description: Dear all, I decided to design a case for the AxoControl from the ground up and get it laser cut and after ages and ages in AutoCAD, finally got it right and sent it of to Duke Studios in Leeds UK [https://duke-studios.com] to get it snipped out in 3m clear acrylic. The midi-sockets stick up on the board so rather than design a slot on the case for them or raise top to miss them I trimmed them off and the whole thing looks neater. More than happy to get the .dwg, .dxf or .pdf file out there if there is an easy way and if anyone wants them

item.title: AxoControl Case File
item.dc:creator: @ronny
item.description:
@ronny wrote:

No problem, I hope its of some use and remember that the tops of the midi sockets need trimming

Read full topic

item.title: AxoControl Case File
item.dc:creator: @ronny
item.description:
@ronny wrote:

No problem, needs 4x11mm spacers but that's in the AxoControl BOM, I also used 4x16mmM3 screws for the top and something like 10mmM3s for the bottom

Read full topic

item.title: AxoControl Case File

item.description:
@hwk wrote:

thanks so much ronny,

thats very generous!
i´ll pass that on to the lasercutter tech at the school, where i teach.
and i´ll post a pic here, when we get it done - might take about 10 days though.

hans

item.title: AxoControl Case File
item.dc:creator: @ronny
item.description:
@ronny wrote:

Of course, are you OK with a .dwg file? You can have a SketchUp model as well, not as accurate but helpful and fun to make. Anyway, I,ve put everything in GitHub, look for the following:

ronnynibletts/AxoControl-Case

Let me know if there are any issues and I'd also like to see how you get on!

Read full topic

as the laser cutter guy from my school mentioned to me yesterday, that he has nothing to do these days, i´d love to help him
so, i´d be grateful, if you could make these files accesible!

item.title: AxoControl Case File
item.dc:creator: @ronny
item.description:
@ronny wrote:

Dear all, I decided to design a case for the AxoControl from the ground up and get it laser cut and after ages and ages in AutoCAD, finally got it right and sent it of to Duke Studios in Leeds UK [https://duke-studios.com] to get it snipped out in 3m clear acrylic. The midi-sockets stick up on the board so rather than design a slot on the case for them or raise top to miss them I trimmed them off and the whole thing looks neater. More than happy to get the .dwg, .dxf or .pdf file out there if there is an easy way and if anyone wants them

AxoControl Case.jpg2764x2622 809 KB
